conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The two cars are side by side at \( t = 30 \) seconds.
The velocities of Cars A and B are given in the v-t graph.
The question asks whether Car A is ahead of or behind Car B at \( t = 10 \) seconds.
We need to calculate the distances traveled by both cars up to \( t = 10 \) seconds to determine their positions relative to each other.
The v-t graph shows Car A's velocity increasing linearly from 0 to 40 m/s over 10 seconds and remaining constant at 40 m/s thereafter.
The v-t graph shows Car B's velocity increasing linearly from 0 to 20 m/s over 20 seconds and then remaining constant at 20 m/s thereafter.
Calculate the distance traveled by Car A from \( t = 0 \) to \( t = 10 \) seconds using the area of the triangle formed by the v-t graph.
Calculate the distance traveled by Car B from \( t = 0 \) to \( t = 10 \) seconds using the area of the triangle formed by the v-t graph.
Compare the distances traveled by Car A and Car B at \( t = 10 \) seconds to determine which car is ahead.
Car A has traveled 200 meters at \( t = 10 \) seconds.
Car B has traveled 100 meters at \( t = 10 \) seconds.
Car A is ahead of Car B by 100 meters at \( t = 10 \) seconds.
At \( t = 10 \) seconds, Car A is ahead of Car B.
